result.execSummary:
The defendant Shane Davon Simpson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Second Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • Flee Or Elude An Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Participate in Restorative Justice program.
Vocational training.
State Patrol Drivers Safety Program.
Cognitive Intervention Program.

Provide a DNA sample.
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA surcharges.  To be paid during period of probation.
If revoked to be paid by defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC. Remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-Court sets restitution at zero.
-Court waives nonmandatory costs, fees and surcharges.

Court advised defendant of right to seek postconviction relief
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored

timeConds.notes:
Report date 11/4/22 by noon.
Huber privileges.
Community service in the amount of 90 hours to be completed.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with count 1.  Credit for 4 days time served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shane Davon Simpson

records.addlTxt: Count two.
Count one.

Sentencing proceeded. Statements as to sentencing. 

AS TO COUNT 1: The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 4 YEARS, concurrent WITH COUNT 2, credit for 4 days time served (as to count 2). The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 2 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 3 YEARS.
*
AS TO COUNT 2: The court sentenced the defendant to Serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction; concurrent to COUNT 1, with credit for 4 DAYS time served.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Serve 12 MONTHS condition time in the House of Correction; with Huber privileges. Report date: 11/4/22 by noon.
- Participate in restorative justice program.
- Vocational training.
- State Patrol Driver's Safety program.
- Cognitive intervention program.
- Community service in the amount of 90 hours to be completed.
- Provide a DNA sample. 
- Court waives NON-MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges.
- Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid by defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

*Court sets restitution at zero.
*Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program, but NOT the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Received and Filed.
Character Letters; Received and Filed.
Received and Filed.

Jury Trial exhibits from 08/29/2022 inventoried on this date.
Location: BOX 791
Verdict forms; Received and Filed.

Jury instructions; Received and Filed.

Pages 1-7 were sent back to the jury, pages 8-9 were left outside of the presence of the jury.

Defendant Shane Davon Simpson in court.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii in court for Shane Davon Simpson.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick J Anderson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

At the hour of 10:05 AM the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY on both counts which was then read.  

"We, the jury, find the defendant, Shane Simpson, GUILTY of 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, as charged in Count 1 of the Information."
"We, the jury, find the defendant, Shane Simpson, GUILTY of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, as charged in Count 2 of the Information."

Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed. 

At the hour of 10:10 AM jury dismissed for the day. Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction. Court ordered all conditions of bail remain in effect as previously ordered.

Case adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 36.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Shane Davon Simpson in court.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii in court for Shane Davon Simpson.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Bailiffs H. Love and A. Kallie are sworn. Deliberations are continued. Parties to return upon notification of a question or verdict.
Received and Filed: Exhibit list and Stipulation for Return/Destruction of Original Exhibits

Defendant Shane Davon Simpson in court.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii in court for Shane Davon Simpson.  Attorney Patrick J Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Trial proceeded (Day 1 PM Session).  Jury in the box at 1:51 PM.  

Sworn for the State: Angel Nazario-Garcia (Glendale Police Officer). Exhibits 1 and 2 received.
Sworn for the State: Joshua Ruppel (Glendale Police Sergeant).
Jury out of the box at 2:57 PM.  Discussions held on the record.  Jury in the box at 3:07 PM. 
Sworn for the State: Nicholas Smith (Glendale Police Officer). 
State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box at 3:13 PM.

Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court.  Court holds colloquy with defendant regarding his right to testify or not to testify. Court finds the defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waives his right to testify.  
Jury in the box at 3:43 PM.  Defense rests.  

State and Defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by State and Defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate jurors selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 4:21 PM to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Adam Waraxa and David Cabral who were duly sworn for that purpose.

...
4:43 PM Case recalled, same appearances.
Jury in the box at 4:53 PM.  At the hour of 4:59 PM, jury is dismissed for the day, but ordered to return at 8:30 AM on August 30, 2022, Branch 36, Rm 316 SB for continued deliberations.

Defendant Shane Davon Simpson in court.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii in court for Shane Davon Simpson.  Attorney Patrick J Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a jury trial (first call).  Parties are prepared to proceed to trial.  Case passed.

...
9:31 AM Case recalled, same appearances. 

Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of 10:08 AM.  
Fourteen (14) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impaneled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by State and Defense.

At the hour of 11:47 AM, jury dismissed for lunch but ordered to return at 1:30 PM to Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.
Received and Filed: Notice of Motion and Motion Regarding Defendant's Criminal Record

Defendant Shane Davon Simpson in court.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii in court for Shane Davon Simpson.  Attorney Patrick J Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a jury status hearing. Parties report that case remains to be in trial posture. Jury trial scheduled for August 29th, 2022 at 9:00 am before Branch 36.

Defendant Shane Davon Simpson in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a final pre-trial.  Matter remains in trial posture.  State informs the court that offer is revoked.  Court scheduled a jury status hearing.  Jury Trial remains calendared on August 29, 2022 at 8:30 AM for first call.  Case adjourned to Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.  Jury status hearing scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Defendant's Motion in Limine

Defendant Shane Davon Simpson in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for Plea/sentencing hearing. Defense has received discovery and an offer and requests matter be set for final pretrial and jury trial.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing. All motions to be filed within 21 Days of today. Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  **All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
filed.

Defendant Shane Davon Simpson in court with Attorney Ariel Rosenberg on behalf of William Anthony Rakestraw.  Jessica Bellows on behalf of Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request case set for plea and sentencing hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Sanders.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Wagner, Br. 38.

Defendant Shane Davon Simpson in court with Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw; both appear by video.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Shane Davon Simpson in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Shane Davon Simpson in custody.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Shane Davon Simpson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
